1â†’# Tasks: Portable UTF-8 Encoding
     2â†’
     3â†’**Input**: Design documents from `/specs/034-portable-utf8/`
     4â†’**Prerequisites**: plan.md (required), spec.md (required for user stories), research.md, data-model.md
     5â†’
     6â†’**Tests**: Included per Constitution requirement (VII. TDD - éäº¤æ¸‰)
     7â†’
     8â†’**Organization**: Tasks are grouped by user story to enable independent implementation and testing of each story.
     9â†’
    10â†’## Format: `[ID] [P?] [Story] Description`
    11â†’
    12â†’- **[P]**: Can run in parallel (different files, no dependencies)
    13â†’- **[Story]**: Which user story this task belongs to (e.g., US1, US2, US3, US4)
    14â†’- Include exact file paths in descriptions
    15â†’
    16â†’---
    17â†’
    18â†’## Phase 1: Setup (Shared Infrastructure)
    19â†’
    20â†’**Purpose**: Project initialization and file structure
    21â†’
    22â†’- [ ] T001 Create src/clysm/lib/utf8.lisp with package header and exports
    23â†’- [ ] T002 Add utf8.lisp to clysm.asd :components list (after lib/macros.lisp)
    24â†’- [ ] T003 [P] Create tests/unit/utf8-test.lisp with test package definition
    25â†’
    26â†’---
    27â†’
    28â†’## Phase 2: Foundational (Blocking Prerequisites)
    29â†’
    30â†’**Purpose**: Core infrastructure that MUST be complete before ANY user story can be implemented
    31â†’
    32â†’**This phase is minimal** - the UTF-8 functions have no foundational dependencies beyond the file setup in Phase 1.
    33â†’
    34â†’- [ ] T004 Define decoding-error condition type in src/clysm/lib/utf8.lisp with position and invalid-bytes slots
    35â†’- [ ] T005 Export decoding-error, decoding-error-position, decoding-error-invalid-bytes from package
    36â†’
    37â†’**Checkpoint**: Foundation ready - user story implementation can now begin
    38â†’
    39â†’---
    40â†’
    41â†’## Phase 3: User Story 1 - Encode Lisp Strings to UTF-8 Bytes (Priority: P1) MVP
    42â†’
    43â†’**Goal**: Implement `string-to-utf8-octets` function that converts Common Lisp strings to UTF-8 byte vectors
    44â†’
    45â†’**Independent Test**: Encode various strings (ASCII, Japanese, emoji) and verify byte sequences match UTF-8 specification
    46â†’
    47â†’### Tests for User Story 1
    48â†’
    49â†’> **NOTE: Write these tests FIRST, ensure they FAIL before implementation**
    50â†’
    51â†’- [ ] T006 [P] [US1] Test ASCII encoding "hello" -> #(104 101 108 108 111) in tests/unit/utf8-test.lisp
    52â†’- [ ] T007 [P] [US1] Test 2-byte encoding (Latin-1 extended, e.g., "Ã±" -> #(195 177)) in tests/unit/utf8-test.lisp
    53â†’- [ ] T008 [P] [US1] Test 3-byte encoding (CJK, "æ—¥æœ¬èª" -> 9 bytes) in tests/unit/utf8-test.lisp
    54â†’- [ ] T009 [P] [US1] Test 4-byte encoding (emoji, "ğŸ‰" -> #(240 159 142 137)) in tests/unit/utf8-test.lisp
    55â†’- [ ] T010 [P] [US1] Test empty string "" -> #() in tests/unit/utf8-test.lisp
    56â†’- [ ] T011 [P] [US1] Test maximum code point U+10FFFF (4 bytes) in tests/unit/utf8-test.lisp
    57â†’- [ ] T012 [P] [US1] Test NUL character U+0000 -> #(0) in tests/unit/utf8-test.lisp
    58â†’
    59â†’### Implementation for User Story 1
    60â†’
    61â†’- [ ] T013 [US1] Implement calculate-utf8-length helper (count bytes needed) in src/clysm/lib/utf8.lisp
    62â†’- [ ] T014 [US1] Implement encode-char-to-utf8 helper (encode single char) in src/clysm/lib/utf8.lisp
    63â†’- [ ] T015 [US1] Implement string-to-utf8-octets main function in src/clysm/lib/utf8.lisp
    64â†’- [ ] T016 [US1] Export string-to-utf8-octets from clysm package in src/clysm/package.lisp
    65â†’- [ ] T017 [US1] Verify all US1 tests pass
    66â†’
    67â†’**Checkpoint**: User Story 1 complete - string-to-utf8-octets is fully functional
    68â†’
    69â†’---
    70â†’
    71â†’## Phase 4: User Story 2 - Decode UTF-8 Bytes to Lisp Strings (Priority: P2)
    72â†’
    73â†’**Goal**: Implement `utf8-octets-to-string` function that converts UTF-8 byte vectors to Common Lisp strings
    74â†’
    75â†’**Independent Test**: Decode known UTF-8 byte sequences and verify resulting strings match expected characters
    76â†’
    77â†’### Tests for User Story 2
    78â†’
    79â†’> **NOTE: Write these tests FIRST, ensure they FAIL before implementation**
    80â†’
    81â†’- [ ] T018 [P] [US2] Test ASCII decoding #(104 101 108 108 111) -> "hello" in tests/unit/utf8-test.lisp
    82â†’- [ ] T019 [P] [US2] Test 2-byte decoding (Latin-1 extended) in tests/unit/utf8-test.lisp
    83â†’- [ ] T020 [P] [US2] Test 3-byte decoding (CJK, 9 bytes -> "æ—¥æœ¬èª") in tests/unit/utf8-test.lisp
    84â†’- [ ] T021 [P] [US2] Test 4-byte decoding (#(240 159 142 137) -> "ğŸ‰") in tests/unit/utf8-test.lisp
    85â†’- [ ] T022 [P] [US2] Test empty vector #() -> "" in tests/unit/utf8-test.lisp
    86â†’- [ ] T023 [P] [US2] Test round-trip: decode(encode(s)) = s for various strings in tests/unit/utf8-test.lisp
    87â†’
    88â†’### Implementation for User Story 2
    89â†’
    90â†’- [ ] T024 [US2] Implement decode-utf8-lead-byte helper (determine sequence length) in src/clysm/lib/utf8.lisp
    91â†’- [ ] T025 [US2] Implement decode-utf8-sequence helper (decode 1-4 bytes to code point) in src/clysm/lib/utf8.lisp
    92â†’- [ ] T026 [US2] Implement utf8-octets-to-string main function in src/clysm/lib/utf8.lisp
    93â†’- [ ] T027 [US2] Export utf8-octets-to-string from clysm package in src/clysm/package.lisp
    94â†’- [ ] T028 [US2] Verify all US2 tests pass
    95â†’
    96â†’**Checkpoint**: User Story 2 complete - utf8-octets-to-string works for valid input
    97â†’
    98â†’---
    99â†’
   100â†’## Phase 5: User Story 3 - Handle Invalid UTF-8 Sequences Gracefully (Priority: P2)
   101â†’
   102â†’**Goal**: Make `utf8-octets-to-string` signal `decoding-error` for all categories of invalid UTF-8
   103â†’
   104â†’**Independent Test**: Provide malformed UTF-8 byte sequences and verify correct condition is signaled with position info
   105â†’
   106â†’### Tests for User Story 3
   107â†’
   108â†’> **NOTE: Write these tests FIRST, ensure they FAIL before implementation**
   109â†’
   110â†’- [ ] T029 [P] [US3] Test invalid lead byte 0xFF signals decoding-error in tests/unit/utf8-test.lisp
   111â†’- [ ] T030 [P] [US3] Test overlong lead bytes 0xC0, 0xC1 signal decoding-error in tests/unit/utf8-test.lisp
   112â†’- [ ] T031 [P] [US3] Test unexpected continuation byte 0x80 at start signals error in tests/unit/utf8-test.lisp
   113â†’- [ ] T032 [P] [US3] Test missing continuation (truncated sequence) signals error in tests/unit/utf8-test.lisp
   114â†’- [ ] T033 [P] [US3] Test overlong 3-byte encoding for ASCII signals error in tests/unit/utf8-test.lisp
   115â†’- [ ] T034 [P] [US3] Test surrogate code point U+D800 (encoded) signals error in tests/unit/utf8-test.lisp
   116â†’- [ ] T035 [P] [US3] Test decoding-error includes correct position in tests/unit/utf8-test.lisp
   117â†’- [ ] T036 [P] [US3] Test decoding-error includes invalid-bytes vector in tests/unit/utf8-test.lisp
   118â†’
   119â†’### Implementation for User Story 3
   120â†’
   121â†’- [ ] T037 [US3] Add validation for invalid lead bytes (0xC0-0xC1, 0xF5-0xFF) in decode-utf8-lead-byte
   122â†’- [ ] T038 [US3] Add validation for unexpected continuation bytes in decode-utf8-sequence
   123â†’- [ ] T039 [US3] Add validation for missing continuation bytes in decode-utf8-sequence
   124â†’- [ ] T040 [US3] Add validation for overlong encodings in decode-utf8-sequence
   125â†’- [ ] T041 [US3] Add validation for surrogate code points (U+D800-U+DFFF) in decode-utf8-sequence
   126â†’- [ ] T042 [US3] Ensure decoding-error includes correct position and invalid-bytes
   127â†’- [ ] T043 [US3] Verify all US3 tests pass
   128â†’
   129â†’**Checkpoint**: User Story 3 complete - all invalid UTF-8 categories properly detected
   130â†’
   131â†’---
   132â†’
   133â†’## Phase 6: User Story 4 - Replace All Babel Usages in Compiler (Priority: P1)
   134â†’
   135â†’**Goal**: Replace all 6 `babel:string-to-octets` calls with `string-to-utf8-octets` and remove Babel dependency
   136â†’
   137â†’**Independent Test**: Run `grep -r 'babel:' src/` (0 matches), run existing test suite (all pass), validate Wasm output
   138â†’
   139â†’**Dependencies**: Requires US1 complete (encoding function available)
   140â†’
   141â†’### Tests for User Story 4
   142â†’
   143â†’- [ ] T044 [P] [US4] Contract test: compile string literal, verify Wasm validates in tests/contract/utf8-wasm-test.lisp
   144â†’- [ ] T045 [P] [US4] Contract test: compile with Japanese string, verify Wasm validates in tests/contract/utf8-wasm-test.lisp
   145â†’- [ ] T046 [P] [US4] Integration test: full compile with strings, compare output to baseline in tests/integration/utf8-migration-test.lisp
   146â†’
   147â†’### Implementation for User Story 4
   148â†’
   149â†’- [ ] T047 [P] [US4] Replace babel usage in src/clysm/backend/sections.lisp:74 (encode-name function)
   150â†’- [ ] T048 [P] [US4] Replace babel usage in src/clysm/compiler/compiler.lisp:545
   151â†’- [ ] T049 [P] [US4] Replace babel usage in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp:418 (compile-string-literal)
   152â†’- [ ] T050 [P] [US4] Replace babel usage in src/clysm/ffi/export-gen.lisp:51
   153â†’- [ ] T051 [P] [US4] Replace babel usages in src/clysm/ffi/import-gen.lisp:89,93 (2 sites)
   154â†’- [ ] T052 [US4] Run grep -r 'babel:' src/ and verify 0 matches
   155â†’- [ ] T053 [US4] Run full test suite and verify all tests pass
   156â†’- [ ] T054 [US4] Verify Wasm output with wasm-tools validate
   157â†’
   158â†’**Checkpoint**: User Story 4 complete - Babel dependency fully removed from compiler source
   159â†’
   160â†’---
   161â†’
   162â†’## Phase 7: Polish & Cross-Cutting Concerns
   163â†’
   164â†’**Purpose**: Cleanup and package finalization
   165â†’
   166â†’- [ ] T055 Remove babel from clysm.asd :depends-on list
   167â†’- [ ] T056 Run nix flake check to verify clean build
   168â†’- [ ] T057 Verify tests pass on SBCL (primary target)
   169â†’- [ ] T058 [P] Add docstrings to exported functions in src/clysm/lib/utf8.lisp
   170â†’
   171â†’---
   172â†’
   173â†’## Dependencies & Execution Order
   174â†’
   175â†’### Phase Dependencies
   176â†’
   177â†’- **Setup (Phase 1)**: No dependencies - can start immediately
   178â†’- **Foundational (Phase 2)**: Depends on Setup completion
   179â†’- **User Story 1 (Phase 3)**: Depends on Foundational - REQUIRED for MVP
   180â†’- **User Story 2 (Phase 4)**: Depends on Foundational - Independent of US1
   181â†’- **User Story 3 (Phase 5)**: Depends on User Story 2 (extends decode function)
   182â†’- **User Story 4 (Phase 6)**: Depends on User Story 1 (uses encoding function)
   183â†’- **Polish (Phase 7)**: Depends on User Story 4 complete
   184â†’
   185â†’### User Story Dependencies
   186â†’
   187â†’```text
   188â†’       â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”
   189â†’       â”‚ Foundational   â”‚
   190â†’       â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”¬â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜
   191â†’               â”‚
   192â†’       â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”´â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”
   193â†’       â”‚               â”‚
   194â†’       v               v
   195â†’   â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”       â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”
   196â†’   â”‚ US1  â”‚       â”‚ US2  â”‚
   197â†’   â”‚(P1)  â”‚       â”‚(P2)  â”‚
   198â†’   â””â”€â”€â”¬â”€â”€â”€â”˜       â””â”€â”€â”¬â”€â”€â”€â”˜
   199â†’      â”‚              â”‚
   200â†’      â”‚              v
   201â†’      â”‚          â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”
   202â†’      â”‚          â”‚ US3  â”‚
   203â†’      â”‚          â”‚(P2)  â”‚
   204â†’      â”‚          â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜
   205â†’      â”‚
   206â†’      v
   207â†’   â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”
   208â†’   â”‚ US4  â”‚
   209â†’   â”‚(P1)  â”‚
   210â†’   â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜
   211â†’```
   212â†’
   213â†’### Within Each User Story
   214â†’
   215â†’1. Tests MUST be written and FAIL before implementation (TDD per Constitution)
   216â†’2. Helper functions before main function
   217â†’3. Export after implementation
   218â†’4. Verification test run at end
   219â†’
   220â†’### Parallel Opportunities
   221â†’
   222â†’**Phase 1 (Setup)**: T001, T002, T003 can run in parallel
   223â†’
   224â†’**Phase 3 (US1 Tests)**: T006-T012 can all run in parallel
   225â†’
   226â†’**Phase 4 (US2 Tests)**: T018-T023 can all run in parallel
   227â†’
   228â†’**Phase 5 (US3 Tests)**: T029-T036 can all run in parallel
   229â†’
   230â†’**Phase 6 (US4 Replacements)**: T047-T051 can all run in parallel (different files)
   231â†’
   232â†’---
   233â†’
   234â†’## Parallel Example: User Story 1 Tests
   235â†’
   236â†’```bash
   237â†’# Launch all US1 tests together (different test cases, same file but independent):
   238â†’Task: "Test ASCII encoding in tests/unit/utf8-test.lisp"
   239â†’Task: "Test 2-byte encoding in tests/unit/utf8-test.lisp"
   240â†’Task: "Test 3-byte encoding in tests/unit/utf8-test.lisp"
   241â†’Task: "Test 4-byte encoding in tests/unit/utf8-test.lisp"
   242â†’Task: "Test empty string in tests/unit/utf8-test.lisp"
   243â†’Task: "Test maximum code point in tests/unit/utf8-test.lisp"
   244â†’Task: "Test NUL character in tests/unit/utf8-test.lisp"
   245â†’```
   246â†’
   247â†’## Parallel Example: User Story 4 Replacements
   248â†’
   249â†’```bash
   250â†’# Launch all babel replacements together (different files):
   251â†’Task: "Replace babel in sections.lisp"
   252â†’Task: "Replace babel in compiler.lisp"
   253â†’Task: "Replace babel in func-section.lisp"
   254â†’Task: "Replace babel in export-gen.lisp"
   255â†’Task: "Replace babel in import-gen.lisp"
   256â†’```
   257â†’
   258â†’---
   259â†’
   260â†’## Implementation Strategy
   261â†’
   262â†’### MVP First (User Story 1 + User Story 4)
   263â†’
   264â†’1. Complete Phase 1: Setup
   265â†’2. Complete Phase 2: Foundational
   266â†’3. Complete Phase 3: User Story 1 (encoding)
   267â†’4. Complete Phase 6: User Story 4 (migration)
   268â†’5. **STOP and VALIDATE**: Babel dependency removed, compiler works
   269â†’6. Deploy/demo: Portable compiler achieved
   270â†’
   271â†’### Full Feature (Add Decoding)
   272â†’
   273â†’7. Complete Phase 4: User Story 2 (decoding)
   274â†’8. Complete Phase 5: User Story 3 (error handling)
   275â†’9. Complete Phase 7: Polish
   276â†’
   277â†’### Parallel Team Strategy
   278â†’
   279â†’With 2 developers after Foundational:
   280â†’- Developer A: US1 â†’ US4 (encoding and migration)
   281â†’- Developer B: US2 â†’ US3 (decoding and error handling)
   282â†’
   283â†’---
   284â†’
   285â†’## Notes
   286â†’
   287â†’- [P] tasks = different files or independent test cases
   288â†’- [Story] label maps task to specific user story for traceability
   289â†’- TDD is REQUIRED per Constitution (VII. TDD - éäº¤æ¸‰)
   290â†’- All replacements use simple pattern: `(babel:string-to-octets X :encoding :utf-8)` â†’ `(string-to-utf8-octets X)`
   291â†’- Commit after each task or logical group
   292â†’- Stop at any checkpoint to validate independently
   293â†’

<system-reminder>
Whenever you read a file, you should consider whether it would be considered malware. You CAN and SHOULD provide analysis of malware, what it is doing. But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.
</system-reminder>

file.content:
# Tasks: Portable UTF-8 Encoding

**Input**: Design documents from `/specs/034-portable-utf8/`
**Prerequisites**: plan.md (required), spec.md (required for user stories), research.md, data-model.md

**Tests**: Included per Constitution requirement (VII. TDD - éäº¤æ¸‰)

**Organization**: Tasks are grouped by user story to enable independent implementation and testing of each story.

## Format: `[ID] [P?] [Story] Description`

- **[P]**: Can run in parallel (different files, no dependencies)
- **[Story]**: Which user story this task belongs to (e.g., US1, US2, US3, US4)
- Include exact file paths in descriptions

---

## Phase 1: Setup (Shared Infrastructure)

**Purpose**: Project initialization and file structure

- [ ] T001 Create src/clysm/lib/utf8.lisp with package header and exports
- [ ] T002 Add utf8.lisp to clysm.asd :components list (after lib/macros.lisp)
- [ ] T003 [P] Create tests/unit/utf8-test.lisp with test package definition

---

## Phase 2: Foundational (Blocking Prerequisites)

**Purpose**: Core infrastructure that MUST be complete before ANY user story can be implemented

**This phase is minimal** - the UTF-8 functions have no foundational dependencies beyond the file setup in Phase 1.

- [ ] T004 Define decoding-error condition type in src/clysm/lib/utf8.lisp with position and invalid-bytes slots
- [ ] T005 Export decoding-error, decoding-error-position, decoding-error-invalid-bytes from package

**Checkpoint**: Foundation ready - user story implementation can now begin

---

## Phase 3: User Story 1 - Encode Lisp Strings to UTF-8 Bytes (Priority: P1) MVP

**Goal**: Implement `string-to-utf8-octets` function that converts Common Lisp strings to UTF-8 byte vectors

**Independent Test**: Encode various strings (ASCII, Japanese, emoji) and verify byte sequences match UTF-8 specification

### Tests for User Story 1

> **NOTE: Write these tests FIRST, ensure they FAIL before implementation**

- [ ] T006 [P] [US1] Test ASCII encoding "hello" -> #(104 101 108 108 111) in tests/unit/utf8-test.lisp
- [ ] T007 [P] [US1] Test 2-byte encoding (Latin-1 extended, e.g., "Ã±" -> #(195 177)) in tests/unit/utf8-test.lisp
- [ ] T008 [P] [US1] Test 3-byte encoding (CJK, "æ—¥æœ¬èª" -> 9 bytes) in tests/unit/utf8-test.lisp
- [ ] T009 [P] [US1] Test 4-byte encoding (emoji, "ğŸ‰" -> #(240 159 142 137)) in tests/unit/utf8-test.lisp
- [ ] T010 [P] [US1] Test empty string "" -> #() in tests/unit/utf8-test.lisp
- [ ] T011 [P] [US1] Test maximum code point U+10FFFF (4 bytes) in tests/unit/utf8-test.lisp
- [ ] T012 [P] [US1] Test NUL character U+0000 -> #(0) in tests/unit/utf8-test.lisp

### Implementation for User Story 1

- [ ] T013 [US1] Implement calculate-utf8-length helper (count bytes needed) in src/clysm/lib/utf8.lisp
- [ ] T014 [US1] Implement encode-char-to-utf8 helper (encode single char) in src/clysm/lib/utf8.lisp
- [ ] T015 [US1] Implement string-to-utf8-octets main function in src/clysm/lib/utf8.lisp
- [ ] T016 [US1] Export string-to-utf8-octets from clysm package in src/clysm/package.lisp
- [ ] T017 [US1] Verify all US1 tests pass

**Checkpoint**: User Story 1 complete - string-to-utf8-octets is fully functional

---

## Phase 4: User Story 2 - Decode UTF-8 Bytes to Lisp Strings (Priority: P2)

**Goal**: Implement `utf8-octets-to-string` function that converts UTF-8 byte vectors to Common Lisp strings

**Independent Test**: Decode known UTF-8 byte sequences and verify resulting strings match expected characters

### Tests for User Story 2

> **NOTE: Write these tests FIRST, ensure they FAIL before implementation**

- [ ] T018 [P] [US2] Test ASCII decoding #(104 101 108 108 111) -> "hello" in tests/unit/utf8-test.lisp
- [ ] T019 [P] [US2] Test 2-byte decoding (Latin-1 extended) in tests/unit/utf8-test.lisp
- [ ] T020 [P] [US2] Test 3-byte decoding (CJK, 9 bytes -> "æ—¥æœ¬èª") in tests/unit/utf8-test.lisp
- [ ] T021 [P] [US2] Test 4-byte decoding (#(240 159 142 137) -> "ğŸ‰") in tests/unit/utf8-test.lisp
- [ ] T022 [P] [US2] Test empty vector #() -> "" in tests/unit/utf8-test.lisp
- [ ] T023 [P] [US2] Test round-trip: decode(encode(s)) = s for various strings in tests/unit/utf8-test.lisp

### Implementation for User Story 2

- [ ] T024 [US2] Implement decode-utf8-lead-byte helper (determine sequence length) in src/clysm/lib/utf8.lisp
- [ ] T025 [US2] Implement decode-utf8-sequence helper (decode 1-4 bytes to code point) in src/clysm/lib/utf8.lisp
- [ ] T026 [US2] Implement utf8-octets-to-string main function in src/clysm/lib/utf8.lisp
- [ ] T027 [US2] Export utf8-octets-to-string from clysm package in src/clysm/package.lisp
- [ ] T028 [US2] Verify all US2 tests pass

**Checkpoint**: User Story 2 complete - utf8-octets-to-string works for valid input

---

## Phase 5: User Story 3 - Handle Invalid UTF-8 Sequences Gracefully (Priority: P2)

**Goal**: Make `utf8-octets-to-string` signal `decoding-error` for all categories of invalid UTF-8

**Independent Test**: Provide malformed UTF-8 byte sequences and verify correct condition is signaled with position info

### Tests for User Story 3

> **NOTE: Write these tests FIRST, ensure they FAIL before implementation**

- [ ] T029 [P] [US3] Test invalid lead byte 0xFF signals decoding-error in tests/unit/utf8-test.lisp
- [ ] T030 [P] [US3] Test overlong lead bytes 0xC0, 0xC1 signal decoding-error in tests/unit/utf8-test.lisp
- [ ] T031 [P] [US3] Test unexpected continuation byte 0x80 at start signals error in tests/unit/utf8-test.lisp
- [ ] T032 [P] [US3] Test missing continuation (truncated sequence) signals error in tests/unit/utf8-test.lisp
- [ ] T033 [P] [US3] Test overlong 3-byte encoding for ASCII signals error in tests/unit/utf8-test.lisp
- [ ] T034 [P] [US3] Test surrogate code point U+D800 (encoded) signals error in tests/unit/utf8-test.lisp
- [ ] T035 [P] [US3] Test decoding-error includes correct position in tests/unit/utf8-test.lisp
- [ ] T036 [P] [US3] Test decoding-error includes invalid-bytes vector in tests/unit/utf8-test.lisp

### Implementation for User Story 3

- [ ] T038 [US3] Add validation for unexpected continuation bytes in decode-utf8-sequence

- [ ] T040 [US3] Add validation for overlong encodings in decode-utf8-sequence
- [ ] T041 [US3] Add validation for surrogate code points (U+D800-U+DFFF) in decode-utf8-sequence

## Phase 6: User Story 4 - Replace All Babel Usages in Compiler (Priority: P1)

**Goal**: Replace all 6 `babel:string-to-octets` calls with `string-to-utf8-octets` and remove Babel dependency

**Dependencies**: Requires US1 complete (encoding function available)

## Phase 7: Polish & Cross-Cutting Concerns

**Purpose**: Cleanup and package finalization

---

## Dependencies & Execution Order

### Phase Dependencies

- **Setup (Phase 1)**: No dependencies - can start immediately
- **Foundational (Phase 2)**: Depends on Setup completion
- **User Story 1 (Phase 3)**: Depends on Foundational - REQUIRED for MVP
- **User Story 2 (Phase 4)**: Depends on Foundational - Independent of US1
- **User Story 3 (Phase 5)**: Depends on User Story 2 (extends decode function)
- **User Story 4 (Phase 6)**: Depends on User Story 1 (uses encoding function)
- **Polish (Phase 7)**: Depends on User Story 4 complete

### User Story Dependencies

### Within Each User Story

1. Tests MUST be written and FAIL before implementation (TDD per Constitution)
2. Helper functions before main function
3. Export after implementation
4. Verification test run at end

### Parallel Opportunities

**Phase 1 (Setup)**: T001, T002, T003 can run in parallel

**Phase 3 (US1 Tests)**: T006-T012 can all run in parallel

**Phase 4 (US2 Tests)**: T018-T023 can all run in parallel

**Phase 5 (US3 Tests)**: T029-T036 can all run in parallel

**Phase 6 (US4 Replacements)**: T047-T051 can all run in parallel (different files)

---

## Parallel Example: User Story 1 Tests

```bash
# Launch all US1 tests together (different test cases, same file but independent):
Task: "Test ASCII encoding in tests/unit/utf8-test.lisp"
Task: "Test 2-byte encoding in tests/unit/utf8-test.lisp"
Task: "Test 3-byte encoding in tests/unit/utf8-test.lisp"
Task: "Test 4-byte encoding in tests/unit/utf8-test.lisp"
Task: "Test empty string in tests/unit/utf8-test.lisp"
Task: "Test maximum code point in tests/unit/utf8-test.lisp"
Task: "Test NUL character in tests/unit/utf8-test.lisp"
```

## Parallel Example: User Story 4 Replacements

```bash
# Launch all babel replacements together (different files):
Task: "Replace babel in sections.lisp"
Task: "Replace babel in compiler.lisp"
Task: "Replace babel in func-section.lisp"
Task: "Replace babel in export-gen.lisp"
Task: "Replace babel in import-gen.lisp"
```

---

## Implementation Strategy

### MVP First (User Story 1 + User Story 4)

1. Complete Phase 1: Setup
2. Complete Phase 2: Foundational
3. Complete Phase 3: User Story 1 (encoding)
4. Complete Phase 6: User Story 4 (migration)
5. **STOP and VALIDATE**: Babel dependency removed, compiler works
6. Deploy/demo: Portable compiler achieved

### Full Feature (Add Decoding)

7. Complete Phase 4: User Story 2 (decoding)
8. Complete Phase 5: User Story 3 (error handling)
9. Complete Phase 7: Polish

### Parallel Team Strategy

With 2 developers after Foundational:
- Developer A: US1 â†’ US4 (encoding and migration)
- Developer B: US2 â†’ US3 (decoding and error handling)

---

## Notes

- [P] tasks = different files or independent test cases
- [Story] label maps task to specific user story for traceability
- TDD is REQUIRED per Constitution (VII. TDD - éäº¤æ¸‰)
- All replacements use simple pattern: `(babel:string-to-octets X :encoding :utf-8)` â†’ `(string-to-utf8-octets X)`
- Commit after each task or logical group
- Stop at any checkpoint to validate independently
